snippet: Conditions for the technology may actually be more favorable in China than in the United States because of aggressive support from the government.
abstract: Self-driving car start-up Uisee Technology, founded by former Intel employee Gansha Wu, is one many Chinese companies developing driverless car technology; analysts say China is poised to be leader in nascent industry, in part because of state funding and also because market there will likely be more receptive to technology than in United States.

byline.original: By JOHN MARKOFF and PAUL MOZUR
byline.contributor: Cao Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Conditions for the technology may actually be more favorable in China than in the United States because of aggressive support from the government.

headline.main: China’s Companies Poised to Take Leap in Developing a Driverless Car
headline.print_headline: China Poised to Take Leap in Developing Driverless Car
